channel.title: Rants on linux dot net dot pk
channel.description: Recent content in Rants on linux dot net dot pk

item.title: 2014 In Review
item.description: Unlike last year , I am not particularly enthusiastic about 2015 , Part of this has to do with the way things are at the moment. If I were , I would have a hard time cheering people up. Professionally, Telecom business is not expanding finally and is more focused on consolidating and cost reductions , with unexpected twists and turns that one has to navigate through. I left my job in 2014 partly due to the extreme stress , which was driving me nuts and was hurting me both physically and mentally , and partly because I wanted to give starting and running my own shop, a try.

item.title: Amazing A380 Traffic
item.description: While logging ADSB traffic around my area [ ~ 150 NM+ Coverage ] ‚Äì I recorded 13 unique A380 registrations in less than 24 hours. Below is a log for reference. <td style="text-align: center;" width="141"> Airline </td> <td style="text-align: center;" width="129"> Date </td> <td style="text-align: center;" width="65"> Squawk </td> <td style="text-align: center;" width="83"> Type of Aircraft </td> <td> Singapore Airlines </td> <td> 2014-12-05 17:14:34 </td> <td> 7622 </td> <td> A388 </td> <td> Singapore Airlines </td> <td> 2014-12-05 17:31:45 </td> <td> 627 </td> <td> A388 </td> <td> Singapore Airlines </td> <td> 2014-12-05 18:33:29 </td> <td> 3423 </td> <td> A388 </td> <td> Thai Airways International </td> <td> 2014-12-05 19:31:16 </td> <td> 7612 </td> <td> A388 </td> <td> Thai Airways International </td> <td> 2014-12-05 19:39:49 </td> <td> 2503 </td> <td> A388 </td> <td> Lufthansa </td> <td> 2014-12-05 19:43:52 </td> <td> 4626 </td> <td> A388 </td> <td> Thai Airways International </td> <td> 2014-12-05 21:17:46 </td> <td> 6173 </td> <td> A388 </td> <td> Thai Airways International </td> <td> 2014-12-05 21:55:02 </td> <td> 404 </td> <td> A388 </td> <td> Singapore Airlines </td> <td> 2014-12-05 22:10:25 </td> <td> 2211 </td> <td> A388 </td> <td> Singapore Airlines </td> <td> 2014-12-05 23:12:07 </td> <td> 2203 </td> <td> A388 </td> <td> Lufthansa </td> <td> 2014-12-05 23:40:48 </td> <td> 567 </td> <td> A388 </td> <td> Lufthansa </td> <td> 2014-12-06 03:34:36 </td> <td> 4614 </td> <td> A388 </td> <td> Singapore Airlines </td> <td> 2014-12-06 05:23:46 </td> <td> 2046 </td> <td> A388 </td>

item.title: Belated Eid Mubarak
item.description: Just reached Riyadh this morning , apart from the random issues with the SPEEDX guy forgetting to ship my car keys to Karachi , the flight was un-eventful , Customs & Immigration was a breeze , The new immigration counters at Riyadh Airport are nice and the agent we went to , was extremely friendly and let us through in 10 minutes. Oh , and this is how I feel after all the meat!

item.title: New Airport @ Multan
item.description: I‚Äôve been really looking forward to the opening of the new airport @ Multan , Pakistan. Saw it today on a flight to Karachi. Read it on 2 the other day that the project is supposed to go-live in December , as quoted by Director CAA. A few pictures of the current status of the project are attached. Cheers

item.title: rm -rf ‚Äòthis_blog‚Äô
item.description: Crap ‚Äì I did it again ‚Äì and this time to the backup as well! Will definitely try fixing / finding old posts. In the meanwhile , I‚Äôll try and update this blog daily. ¬†

item.title: Cisco ASA VPN Woes!
item.description: This is to document the config for outside access to VPN , incase i forget again! access-list outside_nat extended permit ip [vpn client network] 255.255.255.0 any global (outside) 1 interface nat (outside) 1 access-list outside_nat group-policy DfltGrpPolicy attributes dns-server value [dns server] nem enable group-policy VPN attributes split-tunnel-policy tunnelall split-tunnel-network-list none

item.title: Afghanistan ‚Äì Here I come!
item.description: Been really busy lately , so couldn‚Äôt update the blog much , well , I am finally leaving for Afghanistan tonight. Looking forward to the change in envoirnment. I‚Äôll be working in Afghanistan Wireless as an Intelligent Network Engineer, will try my best to keep this blog updated. ¬†Looking forward to a roller coaster ride inshAllah!

item.title: Say what you need to say‚Ä¶ I can‚Äôt! Can you?
item.description: Even if your hands are shakingAnd your faith is brokenEven as the eyes are closingDo it with a heart wide openSay what you need to say ‚Ä¶(John Mayer ‚Äì Say)

item.title: Mobilink WiMax Woes
item.description: My Mobilink Wimax Zyxel CPE died tonight , somewhere around 10 , It first stopped camping and then just stopped broadcasting wifi signals as well , I tried ethernet , but of no use , the 4 port switch is the only thing that‚Äôs working. I don‚Äôt know what‚Äôs wrong with this equipment üôÅ Have logded a complaint on 369 , let‚Äôs hope they can fix this issue. UPDATE: Turns out my indoor CPE was faulty.
